name: R√úSTERS
address: Jl. Raya Kengetan No.44, Singapadu Kaler, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1:
Absolutely awesome! We were very surprised because of the rating, and we actually only came for the pottery, which was also very good! Highly recommended!
But the food!! I had the lasagna, and we had the foccacia with Hummus, babaganoush, and labne combined with the herbsauce from  the k√ºfte was sooo good, also the desert, chocolate tarte and strawberry tarte with coffe was really amazing, we totally loved it!! üíõ
review 2:
Hands down the best place for food in ubud. We went there for breakfast one day, the coffee was perfect.

We also went back for dinner and it was a standout, the food was exceptional. We had drinks at sunset and the staff were really friendly and chatty.

Best dinner we‚Äôve had in Bali !!
review 3:
Went here for a pottery workshop, it was fun and easy to understand for a first timer. Knowledgeable host make it easier to understand about the workshop.

Lunch also had amazing taste, poke bowl with superb wasabi. Huge portion which also a plus point.

The biggest turn down was the black coffee, dark, bitter and when it gets warm it tasted unpleasant. Probably suitable for people who likes their coffee dark and bitter.
review 4: Went here because wanted to have a morning coffee only. Ended up staying until afternoon to have lunch. The place is super comfortable for a good talk. It's quiet and beautiful Rice field. Large parking space which i didn't often find in Ubud's coffee and eatery place. It has both indoor and outdoor space and very spacious
review 5: Amazing space and ambience, friendly and professional staff and both the food menu and bakery are amaaaaazing. My favorite place when I‚Äôm in Ubud. It‚Äôs suitable as both a working space or coffee date in day time, or a fancy dinner at night. You‚Äôre missing out if you haven‚Äôt been here

name: Wadari Retreat Villa Ubud
address: Jln Raya Kengetan, Singekerta, Singapadu Kaler, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1:
I cannot explain just how perfect everything was. Staff are out of this world and amazing chefs too. You are made to feel welcome from the moment you arrive until you leave.
The location is fabulous. You can get around easily with a taxi, which is cheap. There is a supermarket nearby with all you may need. The pool is beautiful and inviting and the whole place has a wonderful sense of calm.
I was very happy with my stay and I will go back!!! Thank you awesome staff for making my dream holiday
review 2: We had a beautiful stay with our group. It‚Äôs located a bit outside of Ubud, which was perfectly quiet. The staff is super friendly. We highly recommend this beautiful place üôèüèª
review 3: Great stay, rooms clean, views are amazing. Abit far from central ubud and busy streets but the place offer bike rental or cheaper option 10 minute walk. Very relaxing off grid location
review 4:
Wadari Retreat is a fantastic place to wind down for quiet-loving families like ours. Our room was generous in space with a kitchen corner to boot. The view of the greenery from our room was breathtaking and picture-perfect!

We were fans of the outdoor pool and the restaurant area that offered stunning panoramic views of the sunset over what should be beautiful rice terraces during the peak season.

The on-site spa treatments available were top-notch and our day ended perfectly with a delicious, reasonably priced meal at the restaurant. Fun fact: they also offer cooking classes!

Despite being tucked away from the hustle-bustle, it's just a 20-minute drive from Ubud center. If you fancy a stroll, there's a well-stocked Pepito supermarket nearby. For families seeking peace and comfort, we can't recommend Wadari Retreat enough.
review 5:
Our family of four found serenity at Wadari Retreat, Ubud. With its peaceful setting in what at the right time of year would be lush green rice fields, it provided the tranquility we needed. What we liked the most about our spacious room was the pantry. It had everything required for a quick snack after a tiring day of exploration.

Speaking of exploration, the complimentary bikes were a real treat! We set off on an adventure finding ourselves in Ubud town just about 20 minutes later. But, if you ask us, our days concluded best at the restaurant. Dining with a view of the sunset over the fields and a reasonably priced menu - magnificent!

Pro tip: There's a neat caf√© nearby and a Pepito supermarket, which is super handy!

name: FARM Warung
address: Jl. Raya Tebongkang No.99, Singakerta, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: Absolutely amazing food! We had the best vegan nuggets of our life, 100% recommended! Stunning view with sunset over the palm trees, friendly staff and great food! It‚Äôs a must go to if you‚Äôre in Ubud!
review 2: FARM has the most delicious vegan Doner in a lovely, simple setting... Try their signature Farm Iced Tea, too - it's cool and refreshing with a limey-lemongrass twist! Best of all... It's all cultivated, nurtured and harvested from the view right in front of you! A cheaper low-key local alternative to the bustling nearby Rusters. Luckily they have their own garden buffer to maintain a bit of their view in the face of yet another block development which has razed the land just beyond the garden wall!
review 3:
Last week- I came back to try their food here and the vibe is not the same anymore, not the same staff. Just like any other places here. The food on their list is mostly fried though "organic". I hope they can revive the old good vibe here. Before they even have breakfast menu and buffet. But now, for some reason I dont like the food they offer. Its just looks unhealthy to me. I ordered french fries and I didnt like it. I also feel like the staff are just there for work. I dont feel the good vibe from them.

2 yrs ago-
They have vegan buffet by donation! first time I heard of that here and it comes with a refreshing home made iced tea. The staff are super friendly, they chat with us many times unlike in other cafe/restaurant. I do love the energy in this place and we got stranded here due to heavy rain, but we never felt intimidated to stay, they even gave us blanket since its cold. I highly recommend this place!!!
review 4:
The best moment of our visit was the sigh of disappointment heaved by a group of ladies at the realisaiton that the menu is all vegan. They promptly left looking for something that suffered before they could eat it. üôÉ

üåØ The menu is small and composed of vegan and freshly-made renditions of fast-foody dishes: nuggets, burgers, fries, donner kebab. There are two or so desserts and several drinks.

The portrayal of portions on the pictures underestimates reality. ü§© What looked like a small burger sandwich was an actual large burger! Everything fresh and crispy from the bun, to the cucumbers, to the soya chunks. Even the ketchup and mayonnaise felt crispy fresh. üòã

The hot lemongrass and lime drink was amazing too, with a whole chunk of lemongrass to stir it.

üå± A stroll around the fruit & veg garden is just *one* sales point of the place, but the bigger one is the trampoline and the slide which can cater to adults too. Trust me, I checked, while making friends with someone's kid. I hope to one day fulfil theI promise of going on a slide with them again in the future.
review 5: Unreal daily vegan Balinese style buffet! 5-8pm all you can eat for a very decent price, texture and flavors were delicious, good variety of dishes, with veggies partially grown on their own farm downstairs, so it‚Äôs super fresh and packed with all the good stuff. I arrived early and witnessed with how much love and care the buffet was set up and then blessed üòá with chefs and all staff members! Many of the guests also ordered THE original Doner Kebab (yes, the quarter Turkish flat bread style Berlin kebab ü§§) Management was there and super attentive and explained the tradition of blessings and some of the dishes. Kid and dog friendly too.( Also got a playground in the back) Nice breeze and views overlooking the gardens and farm. It‚Äôs a MUST.

name: Warung Kintamani
address: Jl. Raya Kengetan No.68, Singapadu Kaler, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1:
We came around 5 pm, ordered 1 mujair nyat nyat and 1 fried mujair (size L) for three of us. We should've asked the grammation or the staff should've told us) beforehand. 1 person with 1 size L fish is adequate.

I'll definitely give 5 star if they update it's payment system, it's cash only. They don't accept card and QR.
review 2:
Absolute Worth the Visit...spicy and tasty Food like we luv it.
All was well presented...staff friendly and attentive and the Pricing isn't out of the World.
Can only recommend
review 3:
We have doubts when visiting as it looks different from existing photos and videos. I believe they have just renovated and actually provided a larger space to dine in.
Mujair nyat-nyat was amazing here, fried mujair also. I love their whole coconut as they add a hint of lime in it, a boost of freshness!
review 4:
One of the best Mujair Nyat-Nyat in Bali. It‚Äôs only a simple Warung. The fish is so fresh, with it‚Äôs tender meat, and no soil taste at all. The portion is generous. You can add with regular rice or Nasi Sela (rice with cassava)

The just renovate the space, so its a bit different from the photo. They have bigger space now, and more comfortable
review 5:
Menu is so simple, fried fish and fried chicken and French fries. Unique beverage, hot orange ginger is available.
Opening till late night is helpful reasonable restaurant at this area.

name: Mujair nyatnyat ubud
address: Jl. Raya Kengetan No.68, Singapadu Kaler, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: Nice menu, fresh fish, and tastefull recipe

name: Arthur Villa
address: Jl. Raya Kengetan No.69, Singapadu Kaler, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: Nice option stay for long term

name: Pasta di Marco Ubud
address: Jl. Raya Tebongkang, Singakerta, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1:
Sucker for fresh homemade pasta!! And this one ngl, the location is not the best area (in Pepito's market) but pasta was so good!! You get to choose which pasta noodle you want as well as the sauce. If you dont know what to get, as them for their reco!

I need to go back and try red sauce! üòá
review 2: What a lovely surprise to find this place right next to Pepito! I mean, what are the chances that you can find fresh, handcrafted authentic Italian pasta in an unassuming, unpretentious environment in Bali? Pasta is very very fresh and delicious, so is the tiramisu. Italian owner was even there to greet and explain. Did I mention the pasta was very fresh üò∏üòÇ?
review 3: Best pasta I‚Äôve ever had! Very recommended when visiting around Ubud.
review 4:
We‚Äôve visited Pasta di Marco multiple times since discovering it, and our admiration knows no bounds. As an Italian, along with my girlfriend, both seasoned professionals in high-end luxury hospitality in the F&B sector, I can confidently attest to the exceptional quality and freshness of the pasta and sauces ‚Äì truly top-notch. Ordering certain items abroad can be worrisome, but Pasta di Marco consistently surpasses expectations.

The unique feature of choosing and mixing pasta types and shapes with preferred sauces is a delightful touch. Their selection of stuffed ravioli, agnolotti, and lasagna, each with various variations, caters to a diverse palate. Additionally, the takeout option, whether pre-cooked by the chef or raw for home preparation, adds to the culinary flexibility.

I must commend Marco, the owner, often present, tirelessly supporting his team with a contagious smile. He embodies true hospitality, humility, and dedication, showcasing a genuine love for Bali and profound respect for it. Such individuals, with a genuine commitment to the local community, are a welcome addition to this sanctuary.

Suksmaüôè
review 5: The price is very affordable, the quality and service was fantastic. Would highly recommend this authentic pasta cuisine to anyone looking to take a break from the super touristy inflated areas of Ubud.

name: Kedai Cengek Ubud
address: F68V+3PC, Jl. Raya Kengetan, Singapadu Kaler, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: Very tasty and cheap katsu chicken and karaage chicken! Recommend!
review 2:
Very lovely Warung.
We enjoyed our food ans drinks a lot.
Good and fair price!
review 3: I went there and it was closed. Whether it was permanently/temporarily/closed on specific days, it should be updated here so people know when to go and when not to.
review 4: Amzing food, chicken karage and cap cay was really good, big portions, good price. Lovely lady who cooks. Maybe that‚Äôs why food tastes so good. :)
review 5: Beautiful place and very good cheap food. Typical bali kitchen in ubud. Not so much people indice very quiet and comfortable Place :) i ll come back for sure

name: Jiknana homestay
address: Gg. Dajan Esempe No.mor 1, Singakerta, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia

name: Warung Alami
address: Jl. Raya Tebongkang, Sayan, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1:
Some described the taste as plain, yes probably compared to your typical Jackfruit Rendang or Quesadillas. As far as Japanese taste goes, this is on par with the typical mid-high end Teishoku menu from good japanese restaurants in the city (read: Blok M) with the added bonus of Ubud atmosphere.

Ordered the set menus of pork and saba, and enjoyed the experience. Both main dishes were quite tasty for the genre, and side dishes were generous. Ingredients feel pretty fresh and high quality, with organic rice, home-made miso, and good natto. Drink selections were pretty good, and price was reasonable.

Recommended for those who wants a good japanese home-style meal.
review 2:
me and my wife really enjoy to have a dinner here, the taste really authentic and the staff is very kind. the side dish is pre-made but the main dish is fresh, we order Ikan Soba set menu and we love it

this place is lil bit far from Ubud center, it took about 20-30 minutes driving bike
review 3: Good food, good place with cool weather, friendly staff. Very enjoyable place for lunch and so homey
review 4: Very nice and cozy place, I took ramen it was delicious, can recommend üôè And cakes are awesome especially brownie ü§§
review 5: Super simple typical and good place to eat a perfect Nasi Goreng in Ubud. Very warm welcome and sercice. Recomended

name: Kayona Art
address: F69V+4GW, Jl. Raya Tebongkang, Singakerta, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: Amazing display of artworks done from the tree roots. They have tables, chairs all the way to artistic pieces worthy to be displayed at five star hotels.
review 2: OMG amazing. Sssshhhhh don't tell anyone, keep it a secret. The art made from tree roots is unbelievable. Get me a container to bring it back to Australia.

name: Villa Seimbang
address: Singakerta, Ubud, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80571, Indonesia
review 1: An oasis perfectly located south of Ubud with beautiful rice-field views minutes from Ubud center. Villa Seimbang blends into it's surroundings with natural design touches that makes it super stylish yet homey. The perfect home away from home!
review 2: Beautiful build with eye for detail, great views and perfectly located. What's not to love?!
review 3: The road to go to this Villa is not really good

review 1: Only 5 km SW of Ubud Monkey Forest. Breathtaking views on rice fields. Perfect bedrooms with aircon, hot and cold water, WiFi, TV in a very quiet area. Super breakfasts, I strongly recommend this B&B.
